Up, its mostly related to dealing with a steady flow of people who read a twitter post at the Holiday In Express and then pontificate as if they're an expert. Lots of 18 year old baristas that think they know about international logistics because the boss let them order the coffee supplies one day.

That is one reason people are so obstinate and confrontational about their ideas these days--they can say they "researched" the topic so they KNOW their opinion is correct.  There is no such thing as "I don't know much about it so I can't say which idea is right and which wrong." 
But not only is much of can be found online incorrect and misleading (and you can find something spouting every possible point of view easily enough), people tend to only read material on websites that support the ideas they agree with--a double whammy.
